edu.jhu.cs.oose.fall2013.brickus.iface

Interface BrickusPiece


  • public interface BrickusPiece
    Implemented by classes which may represent a Brickus piece. A Brickus piece is a two-dimensional grid containing some number of bricks. In this framework, BrickusPiece objects must be mutable. As a result, they will need to be able to issue calls to the BrickusListeners maintained by their BrickusModel whenever they are changed.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flipHorizontally()
      Flips this Brickus piece horizontally.
      void flipVertically()
      Flips this Brickus piece vertically.
      int getHeight()
      Determines the height of this Bricus piece's grid.
      int getWidth()
      Determines the width of this Brickus piece's grid.
      boolean isOccupied(int x, int y)
      Determines whether or not this Brickus piece has a brick in the specified location of its grid.
      void rotateClockwise()
      Rotates this Brickus piece 90 degrees clockwise.
      void rotateCounterClockwise()
      Rotates this Brickus piece 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Determines the width of this Brickus piece's grid.
        Returns:
        The width of the grid for this piece.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Determines the height of this Bricus piece's grid.
        Returns:
        The height of the grid for this piece.

      • isOccupied

        boolean isOccupied(int x,
                 int y)
        Determines whether or not this Brickus piece has a brick in the specified location of its grid.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of this Brickus piece's grid.
        y - The Y coordinate of this Brickus piece's grid.
        Returns:
        true if this piece has a brick at that location; false if it does not. If the coordinate is out of bounds, the result is false.
